intro: Ormosia inopinata, commonly known as the white sand acacia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or secondary vegetation. Its small, white flowers are clustered in racemes and attract various pollinators. Ormosia inopinata is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and supporting local biodiversity.
